channel.title: W3C Media Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Media Working Group

item.title: [media-capabilities] MediaCapabilitiesInfo is a dictionary in spec + Chrome but interface in Firefox
item.content:encoded:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaCapabilitiesInfo needs to be sorted out because of an unfortunate situation across specs and implementation.

This is a dictionary in spec and Chrome:
https://w3c.github.io/media-capabilities/#media-capabilities-info
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/6ad4130faeeead16d8bf620c4387283da143ac09/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/media_capabilities/media_capabilities_info.idl

But an interface in Firefox:
https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/7ef5cefd0468b8f509efe38e0212de2398f4c8b3/dom/webidl/MediaCapabilities.webidl#L52

The documentation should probably still describe it as a dictionary, but filing an issue because it's an unusual situation. It shouldn't really matter to web developers, the difference is just that window.MediaCapabilitiesInfo exists in Firefox.
